title: Electric potential - sphere shell and radii a b c

content.question: A conducting spherical shell is concentric with a smaller, solid insulating sphere, as shown in the figure. The solid sphere has radius <math alttext="a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>a</mi></math> and a net charge <math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Q</mi></math> that is uniformly distributed throughout its volume. The shell has zero net charge, inner radius <math alttext="b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>b</mi></math>, and outer radius <math alttext="c" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>c</mi></math>. Relative to the electric potential at an infinite distance from the sphere and shell, what is the electric potential at the center of the solid sphere?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator k times Q, and denominator a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mi>a</mi></mfrac></math>
<math alttext="1.5 times the fraction with numerator k times Q, and denominator a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.5</mn><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mi>a</mi></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="k times Q, times open parenthesis, the fraction 1 over a, end fraction, minus the fraction 1 over b, end fraction, plus the fraction 1 over c, end fraction, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi><mi>Q</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mi>a</mi></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mi>b</mi></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mi>c</mi></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="k times Q, times open parenthesis, the fraction 1.5 over a, end fraction, minus the fraction 1 over b, end fraction, plus the fraction 1 over c, end fraction, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi><mi>Q</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mn>1.5</mn><mi>a</mi></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mi>b</mi></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mi>c</mi></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="k times Q, times open parenthesis, the fraction 1.5 over a, end fraction, minus the fraction 1 over b, end fraction, plus the fraction 1 over c, end fraction, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi><mi>Q</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mn>1.5</mn><mi>a</mi></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mi>b</mi></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mi>c</mi></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
